name: Hippeastrum
description: Hippeastrum is a genus in the family Amaryllidaceae with about 90 species and more than 600 hybrids. It is native to tropical regions of the Mexico, Caribbean, and South America.Hippeastrum is a perennial herbaceous bulbous plant that has large trumpet-shaped flowers in various patterns. The hybrids are even more extravagant. Hippeastrum is often, but incorrectly called Amaryllis.
meaning: The name “Hippeastrum” is a combination of the Greek words for “horse” (hippeus) and “star” (astron), which means “horseman’s star” or “knight’s star”, as the flowers have a star-like shape.
color_description: Hippeastrum comes in red, pink, salmon, orange, white, yellow and pale green colors.
